explanation: Agent A's report is correct given the code shown. MISRA C:2023 Rule 21.17 prohibits use of string.h functions when they can access beyond the bounds of the object referenced by their pointer parameters. In UT_BSP_DoText the call MsgLen = strlen(OutputMessage); dereferences OutputMessage and scans until a NUL terminator. Within the function there is no NULL check of OutputMessage and no local guarantee that the buffer is NUL-terminated. Therefore, unless there is an external, provable API contract (not shown) that OutputMessage is always non-NULL and NUL-terminated, the strlen call can lead to a NULL dereference or read past the allocated buffer and thus violates Rule 21.17. (If an external invariant formally guarantees OutputMessage is valid and NUL-terminated for all callers, the usage would be acceptable; absent that evidence the report is correct.)
